intro: Diplopterygium novoguineense, commonly known as the New Guinea diplopterygium, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests.
